Posts.Content: Hi everyone my name is Sheryl Im currently having chemo fect t up to forth cycle, and not enjoying it at all, but wondering after my surgery to remove nodes found a lump inmy remaining brest doc thought reaction to having other breast removed because couldnt feel all the time, now I feel it all the time shld I be worried
Posts.Title: breast lump

Posts.Content: Hi , hang in ther e do your Chemo it one of your best chances of beating the beast, I understand yur grandaughters reaction to a point my Grandson 4 wont kiss or hug me any more he thinks he might catch my sick, have tried to explian , that it not that type of sick and been completly honest with him so he does understand to a point maybe tell your granddaughter how much her attitude hurts and that you have to do this as its medicine that will help you get better and be round for all her life not just a little, kids understand a lot more than we give them credit for my grandson is slowly coming around and now shakes my hand and I even get the odd kiss, maybe read to your grandaughter when not at your best or watch her favourite programs with her, all the best and hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Completely fed up

Posts.Content: Hi everyone , I was dignosied 1year ago with a grade 2 ductal cancer had a right side masectomey, then node removal followed by chemmo and radiation finished treatment about 3 months ago, Im back at work but finding it a challenge at the moment feeling really depressed and angry, some days I wish I had never had my mammogram that led to cancer being found feel like Ive lost my life, I know I shld be grateful but cnt get past the feelings Im having at the moment is this normal.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recovery

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for the encouragement and sharing your feelings and experiences, it has helped me a lot, people who have not travelled the road dont realise what a struggle it can be not only when undergoing treatments, operations but after and the road to recovery. Knowing that you are all travelling the same road and some of you a much harder road than myself helps alot so thank you all.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recovery

Posts.Content: Thank you everyone for the encouragement and sharing your feelings and experiences, it has helped me a lot, people who have not travelled the road dont realise what a struggle it can be not only when undergoing treatments, operations but after and the road to recovery. Knowing that you are all travelling the same road and some of you a much harder road than myself helps alot so thank you all.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer recovery

Posts.Content: Thanks Jackie for your words of encouragement,its so hard sometimes people who have not travelled the road seem to think because treatment is finished that life should now be normal dont seem to understand the fatigue and frustration that goes with it,All the best for your operation .
